title: Does anybody else think that Titanic Hydra...
body:
... is Riot's another attempt at making Atma's Impaler? Atma's Impaler was item that was giving bonus AD for how much health you had, it was removed in patch 4.21, if I recall it right. When you think about it, Titanic Hydra will serve the same role: it is going to reward you with extra damage for building HP, just instead of giving extra AD, it is giving increasing on-hit damage. 

I think it's cool that Riot is trying to implement similar mechanics of removed items into new items. Who knows, maybe we will see other removed niche items return in such maner, maybe Executioner's Calling, or Sword of the Divine? Well, time will show, but now we can officially announce: Atma's Impaler is reincarnated.

replies.body: Atma's Implaler definitely came up in conversation when thinking about offensive items for tanky guys. We never tried any tests where we just strictly put it back in the game, but it was somewhat of a starting point conceptually at least.

question : why not stick with old passive then ?

the only problem that atma ever had was that the stats it provided were suboptimal ... mainly due to crit chance 
people dont want to spend gold on stats they dont use as it is usually counterproductive

thats why they steered clear off atmas ... while if we were to give it the same stats as the tytanic hydra has and just kept the passive ... we could get an item that feels better to use (skills and scaling)

The bigger problem is that Atma's rewards you with raw AD for health, which half the roster uses well. That means that when Atma's is efficient, it's efficient on everyone and you tend to see it crowd out everything else, and when it's not efficient, nobody uses it well. Titanic Hydra requires you to use on-hit effects fairly well to be fully efficient, so it shouldn't crowd everything else out when strong and it should still be useful to some champions when relatively weaker (as long as the numbers aren't too far off from balanced, of course).

Mostly correct. Atma's passive gave stats, so it was mostly about whether or not the item was efficient for Tanky DPS builds (other AD characters couldn't use it efficiently). When it was efficient, it was built on every Tanky DPS character (usually in conjunction with Warmog's), and when it wasn't, no one really built the item. It never had a "situational" status, and picking it up wasn't a strategic decision. I'm not sure how effective this new item will be, since it sounds like the same thing but for strictly On-Hit champions instead.

Oh the joy of the Meta-Golem Wukong, Lee Sin, Renekton and Jarvan giving your team a second superfluous anus...

Those were... well, that happened, anyway. I don't know how much I really miss that aspect of the past.

So I'm going to give you the only real response and I hope you actually get to read it:

You want an item that doesn't just reward AD for health, but you want an item that the entire roster will build. You have never (and will never, it's too big an undertaking) balanced champions on whether or not their damage comes from auto attacks or from abilities. Shyvana does EVERYTHING on auto attacks, and therefore tends to be a bit crazy when on-hit items are strong, and tends to be weak when they're weak. Renekton does all his damage based on total AD, and therefore tends to be strong when AD items are strong or at the least other items are not stronger than tank items. 

So you add Hydra but your lamentation is that it only appears to be good on Shyvana. My only response is... duh. All the auto attack bruisers have been balanced against BotRK, with new releases getting fucking %HP true damage for AD just to ensure they don't go with the low AD trinity/BotRK route (Fiora.) Jax will never be competitive again so lets just forget him. 

The second item is Sterak's Gage or something like that. Another bargin bin discount item that bruisers didn't need, didn't ask for, and got anyway. Why is it only bruisers get mid 2000 gold items as essential parts of their kit? You can pretty much separate mid and late game bruisers by whether or not they can go BotRK, and therefore whether or not they can actually add large amounts of gold to their kit before they item cap. 

BUT lets look at Irelia. Titanic doesn't need you to have high damage already to be viable like Hydra does. THE PROBLEM, and I'm going to tell you the solution, is you've made it's active a 20 second CD. What's worse is the active is an auto attack reset instead of an animation cancel nuke. That means champions like Renekton and Olaf who are already hard hit to land auto attacks between their abilities yet like Hydra actually would do WORSE with this item. Worse yet is the 20 second CD means you get it once per fight. So you look at champions like Irelia and the question becomes "will this item help me win fights more than other items." Well it'll proc on her Q which is nice, but the proc on her Q is going to do maybe 10 or 15 more damage than hydra would. Then the active is double the CD of hydra's but might supply a good 100 more damage then the Hydra proc would.

Now ask yourself, do these numbers justify going 3300 gold out of your way for an item you wouldn't have built anyway? Not to mention that the strongest part of Hydra is the AoE lifesteal so you can autowin the laning phase, something that Titanic gives up. Want the solution? How do you make an item that isn't too OP for auto attackers, and isn't too OP for ability users, yet still powerful for tanks? Make it almost entirely activate dependent. 

Make it something like, 50 damage, regular cleave for 60% damage, and then the active is a 10 second CD that goes down by 1 second for each auto attack, 2 seconds for each ability use/1 on multihit abilities. Same 10% HP damage. Now THERE'S an item that starts to look better for all champions. Ability bruisers that went BC for the 20% CDR go "well I can use more abilities so that's a lot of synergy with Titanic!" auto attack users go "wwell it doesn't help my auto attacks so much, but I can land a lot more of those procs!" Irelia would like it, Shyvana would like it, Gnar would like it, Renekton would like it, Olaf would like it. And change it's effect back to an animation cancelling nuke.

So it would read something like: 3300 gold. 50 damage. 100% health regen. 60% cleave on autos. Active: Does 100% AD + 10% HP in an AoE around you. This active is reduced by 1 second for each auto attack, 2 seconds for each ability use/1 second for multi hit abilities. 

That allows auto attacks to spam it, but by late game doing maybe 150-200 damage (their auto attacks) and another ~300-350 damage so lets say 500 physical damage isn't really THAT big of a stretch. I mean, trinity adds 30 damage to each auto, at LEAST 200+ per proc, as well as the 15 other effects it does. So auto attacks get to spam the active more, but it would do less damage. Champions like Renekton would get to spam it less, but they'd do a little more damage on it. Without using the active it's a horribly stat inefficient item by like 1000 gold. With the active it starts to look a little better. Maybe a bit too weak? But at the least it would help to merge auto attack bruisers and non-auto attack bruisers in to a single item. Rather than your current idea which is... well a bit whacky. (Also ability bruisers would have BC, which would help.)

I know you don't have enough time on PBE, but just throw it out there anyway. Lord knows you never had any issue with Luden's and Athene's and BT and the entire AD rework and BC and Trinity and etc. So if it really is broken hard then you can go "welp, we tried." If it isn't  then you have an item that bruisers would actually like. It would also be another little trick to lower the winrate of bruisers at low ELO where they thrive because you're adding another skill to their rotations that they have to manage, which low ELO tends to suck at.

Who is Atama?

It definitely covers a very similar niche, though I think there are a few crucial differences. Atma's helped bruisers deal damage while getting tanky, but it did so by just giving free stats for building another stat that didn't even exist on the item itself, and so was boring and poorly optimized. Its implementation also made it either an auto-buy on literally every bruiser whenever it or health items were strong, or completely useless when they weren't, whereas Titanic Hydra seems like it's a bit more specific (its health-to-physical damage applies only on basic attacks, so it doesn't just inflate the scalings on every bruiser's abilities).

I also think SotD got sort-of-succeeded by Typhoon Claws, which took its triple-auto effect and toyed with it a little. The original item wasn't very well-designed (it was ultra-binary and impossible to balance correctly), but this new iteration looks a lot better, and if made permanent could be a good alternative to {{item:3710}} on laners. Executioner's Calling is a lot less likely to resurface, though, due to Grievous Wounds being phased out from the game, but I hope we get more AD + crit items beyond just {{item:3031}} and {{item:3142}} (Mirage Blade looks like it could be a really cool permanent addition to the game, too).
